intro: Pedicularis sessilis, commonly known as the sessile lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often found in specialized botanical collections and natural reserves.
